io.elegie.luchess.core.indexing.workflow

Class IndexingSession

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.elegie.luchess.core.indexing.workflow.IndexingSession
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class IndexingSession
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable

    This is the main entry point of the indexing framework. Implementations are supposed to create an IndexingSession, feed it using the appropriate setters, then run it, possibly in a separate thread.

    The session processes all data contained in the SourceDataSet, using the threading profile defined in the ThreadingProfile, reporting its progress through the IndexMonitor, and notifying the GameIndexer each time a new game is processed from the source.

    Note that exceptions thrown in tasks are managed in an overridden lifecycle method of the executor service, and not in the session itself.
